title: Was Bennedict Mathurin robbed of Rookie of the Year finalist?
text:
The Indiana Pacers did not have much success on the court this year, finishing with a 35-47 record — somehow managing to miss the playoff race and the Wembenyama tank race by a wide margin. However, there were a few bright spots for the squad from Indianapolis this year as rookies Bennedict Mathurin and Andrew Nembhard had solid seasons. With other young stars including Tyrese Haliburton, Aaron Nesmith and Jalen Smith, the future looks bright in Indiana.
Early in the season, some fans had hopes Bennedict Mathurin could win Rookie of the Year, despite coming off the bench as a sixth man the entire year. While that honor will likely go to Orlando Magic power forward Paolo Banchero, many Pacers fans were disappointed that Mathurin was not selected as one of the three rookie of the year finalists. Instead, Oklahoma City Thunder forward Jalen Williams and Utah Jazz center Walker Kessler joined Banchero as finalists.
This led Barstool Indy — and no doubt thousands of other Pacers fans — to wonder if the national media is sleeping on Indiana.
Andrew Nembhard also received plenty of playing time, especially after Haliburton’s injury. He led all rookies in assists, but did not receive much attention in the Rookie of the Year race.
So how did the Pacers actually compare to the three rookie of the year finalists in the 2022-2023 season?
Based on a combination of points, rebounds and assists, it is clear that Banchero should be the heavy favorite, but Kessler’s dominant rebounding and Williams’ balanced stat sheet give each a strong claim as finalists.


Code
library(tidyverse)
library(hoopR)
library(cowplot)
library(ggrepel)

logs23 <- hoopR::load_nba_player_box(2023)

rookies <- logs23 %>% 
  filter(athlete_display_name == "Paolo Banchero" | athlete_display_name == "Jalen Williams" | athlete_display_name == "Walker Kessler" | athlete_display_name == "Bennedict Mathurin" |
athlete_display_name == "Andrew Nembhard")

rookietotals <- rookies %>% 
  filter(minutes>0) %>% 
  group_by(athlete_display_name) %>% 
  summarise(
    TotalPoints = sum(points),
    TotalRebounds = sum(rebounds),
    TotalAssists = sum(assists),
    TotalMinutes = sum(minutes)
  )

nbatotals <- logs23 %>% 
  filter(minutes>0) %>% 
  group_by(athlete_display_name) %>% 
  summarise(
    TotalPoints = sum(points),
    TotalRebounds = sum(rebounds),
    TotalAssists = sum(assists),
    TotalMinutes = sum(minutes)
  )

benn <- rookietotals %>% 
  filter(athlete_display_name == "Bennedict Mathurin")

andrew <- rookietotals %>% 
  filter(athlete_display_name == "Andrew Nembhard") 

walker <- rookietotals %>% 
  filter(athlete_display_name == "Walker Kessler")

paolo <- rookietotals %>% 
  filter(athlete_display_name == "Paolo Banchero")

jalen <- rookietotals %>% 
  filter(athlete_display_name == "Jalen Williams")

allnbaplayers <- logs23 %>% 
  filter(minutes>0) %>% 
  group_by(athlete_display_name) 

bennbox <- rookies %>% 
  filter(minutes>0, athlete_display_name == "Bennedict Mathurin")

andrewbox <- rookies %>% 
  filter(minutes>0, athlete_display_name == "Andrew Nembhard") 

walkerbox <- rookies %>% 
  filter(minutes>0, athlete_display_name == "Walker Kessler")

paolobox <- rookies %>% 
  filter(minutes>0, athlete_display_name == "Paolo Banchero")

jalenbox <- rookies %>% 
  filter(minutes>0, athlete_display_name == "Jalen Williams")

allplayersbox <- logs23 %>% 
  filter(minutes>0)

bar1 <- ggplot() +
  geom_bar(data=rookietotals, aes(x=reorder(athlete_display_name, TotalPoints), weight=TotalPoints), fill="lightgrey") + coord_flip() + geom_bar(data=benn, aes(x=reorder(athlete_display_name, TotalPoints), weight=TotalPoints), fill="#002D62") + coord_flip() + geom_bar(data=andrew, aes(x=reorder(athlete_display_name, TotalPoints), weight=TotalPoints), fill="#002D62") + coord_flip() +
  labs(title="Pacers rookies in the mix with Rookie of the Year nomineees", subtitle = "Mathurin ahead of Kessler in total points, assists and minutes, while Nembhard leads the way in assists.",  x="", y="Total Points", caption = "") + 
  theme_minimal() + 
  theme(
    plot.title = element_text(size = 16, face = "bold"),
    axis.title = element_text(size = 11), 
    panel.grid.minor = element_blank(),
    plot.title.position = "plot"
    )
  
bar2 <- ggplot() +
  geom_bar(data=rookietotals, aes(x=reorder(athlete_display_name, TotalRebounds), weight=TotalRebounds), fill="lightgrey") + coord_flip() + geom_bar(data=benn, aes(x=reorder(athlete_display_name, TotalRebounds), weight=TotalRebounds), fill="#002D62") + coord_flip() + geom_bar(data=andrew, aes(x=reorder(athlete_display_name, TotalRebounds), weight=TotalRebounds), fill="#002D62") + coord_flip() +  
  labs(title = "", subtitle= "", x="", y="Total Rebounds", caption="") + 
  theme_minimal() + 
  theme(
    axis.title = element_text(size = 11), 
    panel.grid.minor = element_blank(),
    plot.title.position = "plot"
    )

bar3 <- ggplot() +
  geom_bar(data=rookietotals, aes(x=reorder(athlete_display_name, TotalAssists), weight=TotalAssists), fill="lightgrey") + coord_flip() + geom_bar(data=benn, aes(x=reorder(athlete_display_name, TotalAssists), weight=TotalAssists), fill="#002D62") + coord_flip() + geom_bar(data=andrew, aes(x=reorder(athlete_display_name, TotalAssists), weight=TotalAssists), fill="#002D62") + coord_flip() +  
  labs(x="", y="Total Assists",  caption="") + 
  theme_minimal() + 
  theme(
    axis.title = element_text(size = 11), 
    )

bar4 <- ggplot() +
  geom_bar(data=rookietotals, aes(x=reorder(athlete_display_name, TotalMinutes), weight=TotalMinutes), fill="lightgrey") + coord_flip() + geom_bar(data=benn, aes(x=reorder(athlete_display_name, TotalMinutes), weight=TotalMinutes), fill="#002D62") + coord_flip() + geom_bar(data=andrew, aes(x=reorder(athlete_display_name, TotalMinutes), weight=TotalMinutes), fill="#002D62") + coord_flip() +  
  labs(x="", y="Total Minutes",  caption="Source: hoopR | By Brian Beach") + 
  theme_minimal() + 
  theme(
    axis.title = element_text(size = 11), 
    ) 

plot_grid(bar1, bar2, bar3, bar4)

title: About
text: Brian Beach is a senior journalism major at the University of Nebraska-Lincoln from Overland Park, Kansas. Brian has written for the Antelope County News, Knox County News and Stanton Register and he is currently an opinion columnist at the Daily Nebraskan. He has also been a member of the Husker track and cross country teams.
